intro: Cineraria gibbosa, commonly known as the woolly cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Cineraria gibbosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
